Does living in Big Cities offer benefits in comparison to rural areas? What can be done to minimize the disparity between rural and urban areas in India?


Yes, living in cities would definetely add credit to person's life when compared to rural areas. In cities, you can find everything at your nearest and can access things with utmost ease. For instance, the transport facilities, service options, employment opportunities, quality of education and other factors in cities are highly developed than in rural areas. All these are the major reasons behind the migration of huge number of people from rural areas to cities.

Research has proved that approximately 45% of the people in rural areas are moving to cities annually to accomplish their tasks in a simpler way. Cities are the places where you can find highly sophisticated facilities that helps you to lead a luxorious life devoid of any risks. Usually in villages, people generally spend your free time by talking to their neighbours or by involving in some household activities. When it comes to cities, there are countless ways to pass your time such as you have multiplex theatres, shopping malls, gaming zones, fun zones, parks and other recreation centres that reduce your stress.

India is a country where you can find large number of rural areas. All these rural areas defenitely have some impact on the development of the country and its socio- economical status. By developing the rural areas in all aspects such as education, employment and sanitory facilities, the disparity between them can be reduced. Even the Indian government should neccessary actions by introducing several compaigns and programmes that show quick results. Sometimes, there are chances that our country can treated as a underdeveloped country if still there are no improvements in the villages. So, develop the nation to protect its reputation.
